user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_daemon_info:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN const union MHD_DaemonInfo *
MHD_get_daemon_info (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                     enum MHD_DaemonInfoType info_type,
                     ...)
{
  if (NULL == daemon)
    return NULL;

  mhd_assert ((0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_SELECT_INTERNALLY)) || \
              (NULL != daemon->worker_pool) || \
              (MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_valid_handle_ (daemon->tid)));
  mhd_assert (((0 != (daemon->options & MHD_USE_SELECT_INTERNALLY)) &&
               (NULL == daemon->worker_pool)) || \
              (! MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_valid_handle_ (daemon->tid)));

  switch (info_type)
  {
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_KEY_SIZE:
    return NULL;   /* no longer supported */
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_MAC_KEY_SIZE:
    return NULL;   /* no longer supported */
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_LISTEN_FD:
    daemon->daemon_info_dummy_listen_fd.listen_fd = daemon->listen_fd;
    return &daemon->daemon_info_dummy_listen_fd;
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_EPOLL_FD:
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
    daemon->daemon_info_dummy_epoll_fd.epoll_fd = daemon->epoll_fd;
    return &daemon->daemon_info_dummy_epoll_fd;
#else  /* ! EPOLL_SUPPORT */
    return NULL;
#endif /* ! EPOLL_SUPPORT */
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_CURRENT_CONNECTIONS:
    if (! MHD_D_IS_THREAD_SAFE_ (daemon))
      MHD_cleanup_connections (daemon);
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
    else if (daemon->worker_pool)
    {
      unsigned int i;
      /* Collect the connection information stored in the workers. */
      daemon->connections = 0;
      for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++)
      {
        /* FIXME: next line is thread-safe only if read is atomic. */
        daemon->connections += daemon->worker_pool[i].connections;
      }
    }
#endif
    daemon->daemon_info_dummy_num_connections.num_connections
      = daemon->connections;
    return &daemon->daemon_info_dummy_num_connections;
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_FLAGS:
    daemon->daemon_info_dummy_flags.flags = daemon->options;
    return &daemon->daemon_info_dummy_flags;
  case MHD_DAEMON_INFO_BIND_PORT:
    daemon->daemon_info_dummy_port.port = daemon->port;
    return &daemon->daemon_info_dummy_port;
  default:
    return NULL;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found. All controlling expressions in this function are non‑invariant at runtime and therefore do not prima facie violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3:

- if (NULL == daemon) — depends on the caller-supplied parameter daemon.
- mhd_assert(...) calls — these are assertions (macros) and not control statements governed by Rule 14.3; their boolean expressions depend on daemon fields and/or function-like macros and are not compile-time constants.
- switch (info_type) — depends on the info_type argument passed at runtime.
- if (! MHD_D_IS_THREAD_SAFE_(daemon)) and else if (daemon->worker_pool) — both depend on runtime state (daemon and its fields); they are not constant expressions.
- for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++) — the loop condition depends on i (which is modified in the loop) and on daemon->worker_pool_size; thus it is variant.

Preprocessor conditionals (#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT, #if defined(...)) only affect compilation and are not C controlling expressions subject to Rule 14.3. The allowed exceptions to Rule 14.3 (infinite loops and the specific do-while constant-false case) are not present in this function. Therefore there are no code fragments here that need investigation for potential invariant controlling expressions under Rule 14.3.
